author: lovegrovegeorge
title: Catalyst Site:Improve proposal data
description: Proposals lack depth for team profiles, have poor categorization & search. Proposals cannot be easily viewed as single projects.

assessments.note: Another proposal to add functionality that is missing in IdeaScale. The alleged gap is really there.

The problem and the solution make sense and are clear, but the proposal described doesn't clearly describe how it is aligned with this challenge, in reality what has been described indicates alignment with the distributed decision making challenge, because organizing teams according to their similarity is something that allows voters, CAs and vCAs to find out about the teams to vote or evaluate on those teams' proposals. Despite that, I can also see some relationship with this challenge, according to the Guiding Questions described in the Challenge Brief of the challenge, so it is possible to relate something, but to a lesser degree of impact.

Something like this would be a good idea. Improving the formatting and categorisation of proposals would aid community engagement in the reviewing and voting side, and also help proposers find and collaborate with similar proposals.

The idea is good and it would make it easier to understand the teams involved in proposals and also to find related proposals. The improvement of aggregating several proposals that are related to the same problem is somehow limited since there is a small number of projects that would benefit from it. Categories already are a good way to classify proposals, but I agree that some more classification inside each challenge would be even better.

I think this proposal will help to circumvent some of the inherent weaknesses of Ideascale in terms of proposal presentation and also of accountability of proposers. Furthermore, Community Advisors need a way of following up easily on proposals that are part of a package of proposals that were submitted by proposers - and this new website that is in the works could be just the tool to complement Ideascale. 

I think this project could deliver on the task of informing and directing new participants towards increased and better contributions that will ultimately improve Catalyst's ROI.

More transparency, more abilities to scrutinize and develop a proposer's ability to deliver and complete projects will help the ecosystem. I like it. This could become one of the go-to places for in-depth views of proposals and their background teams that are working on them.

I have high confidence that they will be able to create a website. However, the ambition is also to have a "website that provides a central source of information which is constantly updated."
The proposal only mentions the creation, not the operation and content management of the site. Therefore I take two stars away.

There are details about the team and their qualification. I recommend the inclusion of links to Linkedin from all proposers, so that the community has transparency and easy access to check. Considering that the purpose of the proposal is to provide more information about the teams, I think that the members of the team themselves are well aware of the importance of having links to their profiles and even so  two proposers do not have links to their profiles.

There is a reasonable timeline for implementing the proposal (5 weeks), but there is a confusing aspect to the plan, the creation of this proposal will require constant updating and the budget describes funding for only 5 weeks of work. How will be the update of this information? This is not clear. There is a mention that in the long run more information will be added or updated, but would that involve more funding? The point is that to understand the feasibility of the budget.

The plan could use more details. How will the categorization happen. Will proposals be manually categorized by the team running this project? How will the aggregation work? The proposal lists numbnersous probelms that need to be solved, however it is not clear they have planned how to solve them. This may impact the likelihood of success. How will this be funded going forward if it is not fully automated?

The team seems to be experienced enough to implement what is needed for this proposal. Budget is well broken down, but there is no mention about maintenance and next Funds, which would be good to see some information about. Besides that, the plan is clear and is likely achievable.

Essentially, the proposer has provided proof of his experience as a oftware developer with a focus on frontend development, which is required for the project. The expected initial implementation launch date has been set for ~30th May (+/- 1 week) - the project is currently under development, weekly updates are being provided online. 

The budget has a clear breakdown into components and is seems to me very likely that the proposal will be implemented successfully.

The team has multiple proposals in Fund5, all aiming towards the same goal. However, it is not clear who would be responsible for curating proposal data using the tools created.
They want to create a nail but who is the person with the hammer?

The problem, the solution and the proposal are clear and reasonable, but from what has been described I see greater alignment with the Distributed Decision Making challenge (the impact of this proposal would be greater). The roadmap is objective and is divided into steps, the timeline for the implementation is defined in 5 weeks, within the challenge requirements.

There is a budget breakdown, but as I mentioned in the rationale above, there is no clarity if updates are included in the budget. There are details about the proposers' experience. Reasonable metrics have been described, but there are no KPIs.
The proposal could use more detail on how it is going to solve the issues raised, ideally in an automated fashion.

The deadline for implementation of the project is clear, steps and milestones are included as well, and there are some success metrics that are good but could be improved, like the % of proposers that actually use the platform to improve their visibility and ideas, and the number of proposals using the website that actually got funded.

The proposing team is already providing updates on project progress and has defined metrics for success. Implementation has started and weekly updates can be found here: https://www.notion.so/cardanocommunity/Project-Updates-7f42f8cc1648444dbfe6e18b74ccc3b7

The success of the proposal and its progress seem to be easy to measure and follow. The challenge is well addressed and the offered solution seems to be suitable for the task at hand.

solution:
Expand & improve team profile information.

Enable categorization of projects.

Create links between multiple proposals.
experience:
5+ years of web and mobile development experience

1 year of strategic consulting (external & inhouse) experience
